title: daniel_james_david
author: daniel_james_david
content: Looking to Buy Old Crypto Wallets (self custody wallets) with existing Balance Price depends, on age, balance, n of transactionsExample: Metamask wallet with 10K$ in ETH, 3 yo, > 50 transactions --> We offer 11k$Payment method: Crypto, Paypal, Cashapp, Bank Transfer (only USA) , BINANCE PAYWill go first if you are trustedContact infos:Telegram:https://t.me/mr_prince0018Email:daniel_james_david@proton.meSession Id:05396b5cb63ae60b4d46b00d22d2f4f17df22e6cc4331a119a6dcb1efe93b43b0f

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: I have seen such a type of service several months ago but can't remember that post right now. I am not sure but think you are the alt of that post. You are giving 1k profit which can be a good amount. But the person who will trade should be considered as a big problem if the payment is taken from Binance pay and another payment gateway except payment from a non-custody account.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: I think you should revise what you're offering, wallet software can't own balances and crypto addresses aren't labeled with whatever wallet name their keys were generated from. Overall, it's a bad deal. Hope there will be stupid people who are willing to share privatekeys that contains a lot of balance in it.

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: There's something I am not getting cleared here, that's you are looking for wallet address that has a record of total $10k transaction in the wallet to buy?This includes with the private key of the real owner and probably what could be in your mind for person to sell his wallet. Or are you accepting and empty wallet without funds but has transaction for year? Maybe I could reach out to friends if only you are trusted and reliable.

comments.author: bayu7adi
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on August 16, 2023, 03:22:22 PMI think you should revise what you're offering, wallet software can't own balances and crypto addresses aren't labeled with whatever wallet name their keys were generated from. Overall, it's a bad deal. Hope there will be stupid people who are willing to share privatekeys that contains a lot of balance in it.Not to take sides with either the OP or potential clients, but the OP daringly takes the plunge to front the payment for users who boast a commendable reputation. It's a rather equitable approach, even though a few aspects warrant a second thought before we entrust our wallet to others.Quote from: daniel_james_david on August 15, 2023, 08:13:55 AMWill go first if you are trustedHowever, the unfortunate aspect here is that the OP doesn't furnish a definite proposition concerning the margin awaiting the previous wallet owner. Whether it's rooted in a fixed percentage or pivots on the OP's whim remains undisclosed. For instance, shelling out 10k to receive 11k translates to a 10% margin for the original wallet possessor. But what if the wallet merely houses a modest sum of USD $10? Would it merely culminate in a modest gain of USD $11, or could the outcome potentially exceed that sum?

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on August 16, 2023, 03:22:22 PMI think you should revise what you're offering, wallet software can't own balances and crypto addresses aren't labeled with whatever wallet name their keys were generated from. Overall, it's a bad deal. Hope there will be stupid people who are willing to share privatekeys that contains a lot of balance in it.A lot of balance and/or private keys don't matter if you sell the balance and there is no problem. But in this case, it will be full of problems as I think OP will take money back after a successful transaction or OP will send hacked funds or will take reverse the payment. So, if you have 10k$ all will be the profit of the OP.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: bayu7adi on August 16, 2023, 05:55:32 PMbut the OP daringly takes the plunge to front the payment for users who boast a commendable reputation. With some reason, the OP could easily say "you're not trusted enough". Those are just complementary words written in this offer thread. From some buyers of old wallets that I found, they don't also want the balance especially if it was a large amount.Sharing keys is a terrible mistake even with people you trust.

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on August 17, 2023, 03:03:37 PMWith some reason, the OP could easily say "you're not trusted enough". Those are just complementary words written in this offer thread. From some buyers of old wallets that I found, they don't also want the balance especially if it was a large amount.Sharing keys is a terrible mistake even with people you trust.You are right that private keys should not be shared even if you trust that person. There are a lot of cases in the forum that the person was trusted but scammed at a time. The amount can very from person to person. Maximum people has a trust level only few might be exception.

comments.author: JackMazzoni
comments.body: I can sell old cryto wallets with large balance once. They are very affordable. Wallets that was used in 2011 and 2012. But now there is no balance.
